content: Heh, so kinda a fun one that I've been dealing with for a few years now but never bothered to ask. Is there a way to get the color scheme in Rust documentation to "stick"? I use local rustup doc for documentation and it seems the color scheme used is specific to the page it was changed on? The settings are set to ayu globally, but it doesn't seem to do anything. The per-page paintbrush changes the color but it seems like only for that page. What have I been missing for so long?
My suspicion is that maybe it has something to do with storage/settings for websites on a file:/// path?

Most browsers do not allow pages from different file locations from accessing the localstorage information needed to store settings. Some browsers allow you to turn off that restriction in the settings, though I don't particularly recommend that. You can run a server like python3 -m http.server to browse them via localhost.
Sounds good, I'll just host em then!
It's amazing! Everything is now the same color! WOO!
